title: Protocol for isolating human BCAM-positive corneal progenitor cells by flow cytometry and cell sorting
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Dissection and dissociation of the human limbal epithelial cells
Timing: 2–3 h
This section describes steps to dissect and dissociate the limbal epithelial cells from human donor corneas (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1])2[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib5]
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2959-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. Dissection and dissociation of the human limbal epithelial cells
(A) Donor cornea placed in a 6-well plate. Epithelial side is facing downward and endothelial side is facing upward.
(B) Removal of the iris tissue attached to the back of the cornea by forceps.
(C) Punching out the central cornea by an 8 mm disposable biopsy punch.
(D) Separation of limbus and central cornea.
(E) Mechanical removal of the corneal endothelium by forceps.
(F) Incubation of limbal tissue in 2 mL of PluriSTEM Dispase II Solution.
(G) Scraping off the limbal epithelial cells by forceps.
(H) Incubation of limbal epithelial cells in 400 μL of TrypLE Express Enzyme.
(I) Removal of cell clumps by filtering the cells through 35 μm cell strainer.
(J) Cell count.
Dissection of human donor corneas
Rinse the human donor cornea and remove the iris tissue attached to the back of the cornea in PBS in a 6-well plate.
Transfer the tissue to a new well of a 6-well plate with PBS and punch out the central cornea by an 8 mm disposable biopsy punch (Integra LifeSciences, Plainsboro, NJ).
Remove corneal endothelium mechanically by using forceps.
Dissociation of human limbal epithelial cells
Submerge the limbal tissue in 2 mL of PluriSTEM Dispase II Solution (1 mg/mL) and incubate for 1 h at 37°C in a CO2 incubator.
Rinse the limbal tissue with PBS twice.
Scrape off the limbal epithelial cells into new PBS by using forceps.
Transfer the limbal epithelial cells with PBS into 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tubes.

Centrifuge the cell suspension at 500 g for 5 min at 20°C–25°C.
Remove the supernatant and resuspend the cells in 400 μL of TrypLE Express Enzyme.
Incubate for 30 min in a 37°C water bath.
Add 600 μL of FACS buffer and centrifuge the cell suspension at 500 g for 5 min at 4°C.
Resuspend the cells with 1 mL of FACS buffer.
Remove the cell clumps by filtering the cells through 35 μm cell strainer (BD Biosciences, San Jose, CA).
Count the cell number.
Centrifuge the cell suspension at 500 g for 5 min at 4°C.
Resuspend the cells at the concentration of 1 × 106 cells/mL.
Antibody staining
Timing: 1–2 h
This section describes steps of staining the limbal epithelial cells with anti-BCAM monoclonal antibody (mAb) and Propidium Iodide (PI) for dead cells removal.
Antibody staining.
Separate the cell suspension into 5 tubes as below.
table:files/protocols_protocol_2959_4.csv
Add VioBright FITC-conjugated anti-BCAM mAb to tubes #2 and #4 (Dilution is 1:10).
Add VioBright FITC-conjugated REA Control Antibody to tube #3 (Dilution is 1:50).
Incubate for 30 min on ice.
Fill each tube up to 1 mL with FACS buffer and centrifuge the cell suspension at 500 g for 5 min at 4°C.
Remove the supernatant, add 1 mL of FACS buffer and centrifuge the cell suspension at 500 g for 5 min at 4°C.
Repeat the above step (3f) once more.
Resuspend the cells with the original amount of cell suspension.
Dead cell staining by PI.
Add PI at 1:100 dilution and incubate for 10 min on ice.
Optional: Add 2.5 μg/mL Alexa Fluor 647-conjugated anti-ABCB5 mAb to detect ABCB5-positive limbal stem cells as well as BCAM-positive progenitors. Refer to Sasamoto et al. for detailed protocol for ABCB5 staining.3[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib2]

Optional: Other dead cell staining reagents (e.g., DAPI, 7-AAD) can be used instead of PI.
Note: Use all remaining cell suspension for tube #2 to increase the number of BCAM-positive cells isolated by flow cytometry.
Critical: PI is a potential carcinogen. Wear protective clothing, gloves and eye/face protection.
Flow cytometry
Timing: 1 h
This section describes the steps for isolating BCAM-positive and negative- cells from the limbal epithelial cell suspensions.
Set up the flow cytometry machine.
Note: FACSAria II cell sorter (BD Biosciences) is used for the current protocol.
Gate settings (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2959-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. Gate settings for the flow cytometry
(A) Cellular debris removal based on FSC-A and SSC-A.
(B) Doublet removal based on SSC-W and SSC-H.
(C) Doublet removal based on FSC-W and SSC-H.
(D) Isolation of live cells as Propidium Iodide (PI)-negative cells. Determine the viable cell gating by comparing the tubes #2 (Anti-BCAM mAb + PI) and #4 (Anti-BCAM mAb only).
(E) BCAM-positive cell isolation. Determine the BCAM-positive and -negative cell gating by comparing the tubes #2 (Anti-BCAM mAb + PI) and #3 (Isotype control mAb + PI). FSC, forward scatter; A, area; SSC, side scatter; W, width; H, height.
Adjust the scale of forward scatter (FSC)-A and side scatter (SSC)-A using tube #1.
Run all the remaining samples for the analyses.
Adjust settings for spectral compensation using tubes #4 and #5.
Remove cellular debris based on the FSC-A and SSC-A.
Remove doublets based on SSC-W and SSC-H.
Remove doublets based on FSC-W and FSC-H.
Determine the viable cell gating by comparing the tubes #2 and #4.
Determine the BCAM-positive and -negative cell gating by comparing the tubes #2 and #3.
Sort BCAM-positive and -negative cells from tube #2.

Note: Use 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tubes with 300 μL of KCM supplemented with 10 ng/mL KGF and 10 μM Y-27632 for cell collection.
Note: Sort the same number of BCAM-positive and -negative cells.
Cell culture
Timing: 3 weeks
This section describes steps to culture the purified BCAM-positive and -negative cells for holoclone and cell sheet formation assays.
Holoclone assay (Figure 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]).4[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3],5[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib6],6[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib7]
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2959-Fig3.jpg
Figure 3. Holoclone assay
(A) Preparation of Mitomycin C (MMC)-treated 3T3-J2 cells.
(B) Seeding of 500 sorted BCAM-positive and -negative cells on the MMC-treated 3T3-J2 cells.
(C) Initial colony forming assay.
(D) Cell reseeding and holoclone assay.
Remove the 3T3-J2 culture media from 6-well plates with MMC-treated 3T3-J2 cells and add 2 mL of KCM supplemented with 10 ng/mL KGF and 10 μM Y-27632.
Seed sorted BCAM-positive and -negative cells on the MMC-treated 3T3-J2 cells at 500 cells per well on a 6-well plate.
Note: Seed the cells into at least two wells of a 6-well plate. One for initial colony forming assay (CFA) to calculate colony-forming efficiency (CFE) and the other for reseeding for holoclone formation.
Incubate the cells for 10 days at 37°C in a CO2 incubator.
Note: Change the media every 2–3 days.
Prepare MMC-treated 3T3-J2 cells at day 7–9 in 6-well plates.
Note: Prepare enough number of 6-well plates for cell reseeding for holoclone assay.
Cell reseeding at day 10.
Remove the media from MMC-treated 3T3-J2 cells (step 8d) and add 2 mL of KCM media.
Remove the 3T3-J2 cells by gentle pipetting from one of the wells from step 8c.
Replace the media to CEM.
Pick up the colonies under microscope and transfer each colony to a single 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube with 50 μL of PBS supplemented with 0.5 μL of B-27 Supplement.

Add 300 μL of TrypLE Express Enzyme to each tube and incubate for 15 min in a 37°C water bath.
Vortex for 5–10 s and pipette the cells 10 times.
Seed 110 μL of cell suspension to each well prepared in step 8e-i.
Incubate the cells for 10 days at 37°C in a CO2 incubator.
Note: Change the media every 2–3 days.
Note: Add 1–2 more days for incubation if the colonies are small.
Calculate CFE from initial CFA wells.
Fix the cells in one of the wells from step 8c with 10% formalin for 1 h at 20°C–25°C.
Rinse the cells with distilled water three times and incubate for 1 h at 20°C–25°C in the last distilled water.
Remove the distilled water, add 2 mL of 2% Rhodamine and incubate for 72 h at 20°C–25°C.
Remove the Rhodamine and rinse with 0.2 M hydrogen chloride three times.
Dry and take images of stained colonies.
Calculate CFE as a ratio of the colony numbers per well to the seeded cell numbers (500 cells).
After 10 days culture of the cells from step 8e, fix the cells with 10% formalin for 1 h at 20°C–25°C.
Rinse the cells with distilled water three times and incubate for 1 h at 20°C–25°C in the last distilled water.
Remove the distilled water, add 2 mL of 2% Rhodamine and incubate for 72 h at 20°C–25°C.
Remove the Rhodamine and rinse with 0.2 M hydrogen chloride three times.
Dry and take images of stained colonies.
Determine clonal type by the protocol shown in Pellegrini et al.4[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib3]
table:files/protocols_protocol_2959_5.csv
Calculate the percentage of holoclones by multiplying the CFE (%) (step 8f-vi) by the percentage of wells containing a holoclone among the seeded wells (step 8L).
Cell sheet formation assay (Figure 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig4]).

Figure 4. Cell sheet formation assay
(A) Preparation of Mitomycin C (MMC)-treated 3T3-J2 cells and iMatrix-511 coating.
(B) Seeding of 500 sorted BCAM-positive and -negative cells on the insert.
(C) Removal of the media from top of the insert (airlifting).
(D) Embedding cell sheets cut in half into O.C.T. compound.
(E) Observation of cell sheets by Hematoxylin and eosin (HE) staining, immunofluorescence or immunohistochemistry. Example shows HE staining of cell sheet derived from BCAM-positive cells and -negative cells (upper panel) and immunofluorescence of mature corneal epithelium markers, Keratin 12 (KRT12) and Mucin 16 (MUC16) in the cell sheet derived from BCAM-positive cells (lower panel). Nuclei stained with Hoechst 33342 (blue). Scale bar, 20 μm.
Place 24-well inserts onto the 24-well plates.
Coat 24-well insert with iMatrix-511 at 0.5 μg/cm2 in 200 μL of PBS by incubation at 37°C for 1 h.
Remove the 3T3-J2 culture media from 24-well plates with MMC-treated 3T3-J2 cells and add 1.25 mL of KCM supplemented with 10 ng/mL KGF and 10 μM Y-27632.
Remove PBS with iMatrix-511 from the inserts and transfer the inserts to 24-well plates with MMC-treated 3T3-J2 cells prepared in Step 9c.
Add 250 μL of KCM supplemented with 10 ng/mL KGF and 10 μM Y-27632 to the upper part of the 24-well inserts.
Seed sorted BCAM-positive and -negative cells on the insert at 500 cells per well.
Incubate the cells for 15 days at 37°C in a CO2 incubator.
Note: Change the media every 2–3 days.
Remove the media from top of the insert (airlifting) at day 15.
Incubate the cells for 5 more days at 37°C in a CO2 incubator.
Note: Change the media under the insert every 2–3 days.
Rinse the insert with PBS once.

Cut apart the bottom part of the insert with cell sheet from the anchor of the insert and cut the cell sheet in half.
Soak the cell sheets in 4% paraformaldehyde and incubate for 15 min at 20°C–25°C.
Rinse the cell sheet with Tris Buffered Saline (TBS) for 10 min at 20°C–25°C twice.
Submerge the cell sheets into O.C.T compound and freeze them in −80°C.
Make sections of the cell sheet by cryostat.
Proceed to Hematoxylin and eosin (HE) staining, immunofluorescence or immunohistochemistry.
Use Hematoxylin and Eosin Stain Kit (Vector Laboratories, Burlingame, CA) for HE staining.
Perform immunostaining of Keratin 12 (KRT12) and Mucin 16 (MUC16).
Rinse the section with TBS for 10 min at 20°C–25°C.
Permeabilize and block the section with blocking buffer (TBS containing 5% normal donkey serum and 0.3% Triton X-100) for 30 min at 20°C–25°C.
Dilute primary antibodies (rabbit anti-KRT12 mAb and mouse anti-MUC16 mAb) with staining buffer (TBS containing 1% normal donkey serum and 0.3% Triton X-100) at 1:400.
Remove blocking buffer, add diluted primary antibodies and incubate 8–12 h at 4°C.
Rinse the section with TBS for 10 min at 20°C–25°C twice.
Dilute secondary antibodies (Donkey anti-Mouse IgG- Alexa Fluor 488 and Donkey anti-Rabbit IgG- Alexa Fluor 568) with staining buffer at 1:400.
Add diluted secondary antibodies and incubate for 1 h at 20°C–25°C in the dark.
Dilute Hoechst 33342 with staining buffer at 1:400.
Remove secondary antibodies and add diluted Hoechst 33342 and incubate for 10 min at 20°C–25°C in the dark.
Rinse the section with TBS for 10 min at 20°C–25°C twice in the dark.
Seal the slides with ProLong Gold Antifade Mountant.
Take images of slides by C2+ confocal microscope (Nikon, Tokyo, Japan) and analyze by NIS-Elements AR v4.30.01 (Nikon).
